choices.F: IPsec transport mode encrypts the entire packet
choices.B: IPsec transport mode is used between gateways
choices.A: IPsec transport mode is used between end stations
choices.E: IPsec transport mode encrypts only the payload

questions.answer_description:
IPSec can be run in either tunnel mode or transport mode. Each of these modes has its own particular uses and care should be taken to ensure that the correct one is selected for the solution:
✑ is most commonly used between gateways, or at an end-station to a gateway, the gateway acting as a proxy for the hosts behind it.
✑ is used between end-stations or between an end-station and a gateway, if the gateway is being treated as a hostfor example, an encrypted
Telnet session from a workstation to a router, in which the router is the actual destination.
Reference:
http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=25477
questions.question_text: Which of the following are features of IPsec transport mode? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: according to the explanation attached below, I think 'B' should be true also, shouldn't it?

questions.question_text: Which technology can you implement to centrally mitigate potential threats when users on your network download files that might be malicious?

choices.D: Verify that antivirus software is installed and up to date for all users on your network.
choices.C: Enable file-reputation services to inspect all files that traverse the company network and block files with low reputation scores.
choices.A: Verify that the company IPS blocks all known malicious websites.
choices.B: Implement URL filtering on the perimeter firewall.

discussion.content:
Of the three billion objects that employees requested during the first quarter of production for the East Cost, 52 percent were blocked because of a low reputation score.

Low reputation cannot be a good thing.



Source: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise/cisco-on-cisco/Cisco_IronPort_Web_Security_Appliance_final.html

Cisco email security appliances reject email from servers with low scores (below –3.0.) and rate-limit send-ers that have medium to low reputation scores. They can also white-list high reputation senders, such as IP addresses with +9.0 scores from Fortune 1000 organizations.

Answer B
Low reputation scores should be passed. High reputation files get scanned. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/i/400001-500000/410001-420000/415001-416000/415735.tif/_jcr_content/renditions/415735.jpg
OSPF can be configured to authenticate every OSPF message. This is usually done to prevent a rogue router from injecting false routing information and therefore causing a Denial-of-Service attack.
